citeinfo.title: Ports USA 2011

citeinfo.origin: United States. Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Office of Geographic Information Services
citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2011

pubinfo.publish: United States. Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Office of Geographic Information Services

descript.abstract: This point dataset represents ports in the United States. The data consists of listings of port area's waterfront facilities, including information on berthing, cranes, transit sheds, grain elevators, marine repair plants, fleeting areas, and docking and storage facilities. Collection of data is performed on a rotational basis to ensure on-site accuracy at each facility.
descript.purpose: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.

idinfo.datacred: The National Waterway Network was created on behalf of the Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, the U.S. Bureau of Census, and the U.S. Coast Guard by Vanderbilt University and Oak Ridge National Laboratory. Additional agencies with input into network development include Volpe National Transportation Systems Center, Maritime Administration, Military Traffic Management Command, Tennessee Valley Authority, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, and the Federal Railroad Administration.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

citeinfo.origin: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)
citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2011

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy is tested by manual comparison of the source with hard copy printouts and/or symbolized display of digital line graphs on an interactive computer graphic system; selected attributes that cannot be visually verified on plots or on screen, are interactively queried and verified on screen.

dataqual.logic: RITA/BTS quality checks were to cross reference the place dataset with the state dataset, to determine that the spatial data and attribute data were accurate

horizpa.horizpar: The accuracy of each point element is correlated to the data source used to derive that element. For example, links and nodes derived from 1:100,000 scale Digital Line Graphs are more accurate than links and nodes derived from 1:500,000 scale NOAA Navigational Charts. Elements with an "M" in the source field (indicating an unknown or missing source) are the least accurate.

citeinfo.origin: Vanderbilt Engineering Center for Transportation Operations and Research Vanderbilt University
citeinfo.title: USACE Port Database

procstep.procdesc: Extraction of the USACE identified port nodes from the National Waterway Network file.

In order to meet Tufts University's metadata standards: >Changed citatition title from "ports" to "Ports USA 2011" >Changed originators/publishers from "Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)" and "US Army Corps of Engineers (USACE)" to "United States. Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Office of Geographic Information Services" and "United States. Army. Corps of Engineers" >Added theme keyword "point" to added theme keyword thesaurus "FGDC" >Added ISO 19115 Topic Category keywords >Added LCSH theme keywords >Added GNS place keywords >Changed access contraints from "None" to "Unrestricted Access Online" >Changed publication place to reflect LCNH formatting >Replaced Tufts as the distributor >Changed name of file from "ports" to "USAPorts11" >Exported metadata

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: A description of the physical and Intermodal (infrastructure) characteristics of the: coastal, Great Lakes, and inland ports of the United States.
